intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium insuetum subsp. castriferrei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically has slender, hairy stems and linear to lanceolate leaves that are often crowded at the base. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, and it is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller, more compact inflorescences compared to other members of the *Hieracium* genus.
